docs.text: DODAS client Reference Manual Quick start Download the binary from the latest release on github . For instance: wget https://github.com/Cloud-PG/dodas-go-client/releases/download/v0.2.2/dodas.zip unzip dodas.zip cp dodas /usr/local/bin You can find now a template for creating your client configuration file in config/client_config.yaml . Note that by default the client will look for $HOME/.dodas.yaml . Now you are ready to go. For instance you can validate a tosca template like this: dodas validate --template tests/tosca/valid_template.yml or you can create a cluster through the InfrastructureManager configured in your configuration file: dodas create --config my_client_conf.yaml my_template.yaml To list the Infrastructure ID of all your deployments: dodas list infIDs Using docker image In alternative you can create a docker image with the compiled client inside with: make docker-img-build and then you can bind the configuration files and run the previous commands as: # list the Infrastructure ID of all your deployments docker run -v $HOME/.dodas.yaml:/app/.dodas.yaml --rm dodas list infIDs Building from source To compile on a linux machine (go version that supports go modules is required for building from source: e.g. >= v1.12): make build while to compile with Docker: make docker-build It's also possible to cross compile for windows and macOS with: make windows-build make macos-build Contributing If you want to contribute: create a branch upload your changes create a pull request Thanks!
docs.title: DODAS client

docs.text: Reference Manual
docs.title: DODAS client

docs.text: Download the binary from the latest release on github . For instance: wget https://github.com/Cloud-PG/dodas-go-client/releases/download/v0.2.2/dodas.zip unzip dodas.zip cp dodas /usr/local/bin You can find now a template for creating your client configuration file in config/client_config.yaml . Note that by default the client will look for $HOME/.dodas.yaml . Now you are ready to go. For instance you can validate a tosca template like this: dodas validate --template tests/tosca/valid_template.yml or you can create a cluster through the InfrastructureManager configured in your configuration file: dodas create --config my_client_conf.yaml my_template.yaml To list the Infrastructure ID of all your deployments: dodas list infIDs
docs.title: Quick start

docs.text: In alternative you can create a docker image with the compiled client inside with: make docker-img-build and then you can bind the configuration files and run the previous commands as: # list the Infrastructure ID of all your deployments docker run -v $HOME/.dodas.yaml:/app/.dodas.yaml --rm dodas list infIDs
docs.title: Using docker image

docs.text: To compile on a linux machine (go version that supports go modules is required for building from source: e.g. >= v1.12): make build while to compile with Docker: make docker-build It's also possible to cross compile for windows and macOS with: make windows-build make macos-build
docs.title: Building from source

docs.text: If you want to contribute: create a branch upload your changes create a pull request Thanks!
docs.title: Contributing

docs.text: dodas A self-sufficient client for DODAS deployments Synopsis A self-sufficient client for DODAS deployments. Default configuration file searched in $HOME/.dodas.yaml Usage examples: """ CREATE A CLUSTER FROM TEMPLATE dodas create --template my_tosca_template.yml VALIDATE TOSCA TEMPLATE dodas validate --template my_tosca_template.yml """ dodas [flags] Options --config string DODAS config file (default is $HOME/.dodas.yaml) -h, --help help for dodas -v, --version DODAS client version SEE ALSO dodas create - Create a cluster from a TOSCA template dodas destroy - Destroy infrastructure with this InfID dodas get - Wrapper command for get operations dodas list - Wrapper function for list operations dodas login - WIP feature: ssh login into a deployed vm dodas validate - Validate your tosca template dodas version - Client version Auto generated by spf13/cobra on 8-Apr-2019
docs.title: Dodas
